oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Copy of crayon print of Joseph Wilson Rose, Co. D, 5th Tenn. Inf. Regt., USA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pvt. Rose and his father both went early in the war to Barboursville, Ky. to enlist in Co. D, 5th Tenn. Inf. Regt., USA. His father, Elijah, did not survive the war, dying in Bowling Green, Ky. in Jan. 1863. They enlisted in Kentucky due to the occupation of East Tenn. by Confederate forces. They fought at Stones River and then served on occupation duty in Carthage and around Chattanooga. They were in the center of the Union line at Franklin, Tennessee on November 30, 1864.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Rose, Joseph Wilson
